item.title: Can Democrats Accept the Obvious?
item.description: Lessons from the Tea Party and recent elections.

item.title: Why Won’t Congress Use Its Power?
item.description: Five Republicans just voted with Democrats to block Trump’s tariffs. This proves Congress can act. So why isn’t it using that same power to address hunger, health care costs or undeclared wars? The New York Times Opinion editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, explains.

item.title: Bros Need Some Bros
item.description: Commercial camaraderie underscores how it’s lacking in real life.

item.title: The Last Days of a Zombie Mall (With Zombies)
item.description: What does it mean when a cultural epicenter is poised to be little more than a dearly departed corpse?

item.title: How the Supreme Court Paved the Way for Revenge Prosecutions
item.description: It was right to decry factional strife. Its remedy was a grave mistake.

item.title: Why Do We Allow Child Marriage in America?
item.description: Girls as young as 10 are sometimes legally wed here in the U.S., even as we tell other countries to end this cruel practice.

item.title: Congress Is Dying in Real Time
item.description: This is what happens when no one wants to govern.

item.title: What Is the Point of Family Dinner?
item.description: Readers respond to an Opinion guest essay by Erin O. White about how she stopped cooking dinner.

item.title: ‘Kill, Kill, Kill’: How to Wrestle With Death in Gaza
item.description: Israelis must debate three claims: that killing tens of thousands in Gaza was necessary, not Israel’s fault and the inevitable outcome of a high-tech war.

item.title: Congress Is Dying in Real Time
item.description: This is what happens when no one wants to govern.

item.title: Hey, Lefties! Trump Has Stolen Your Game.
item.description: MAGA is using left ideas to destroy the left.

item.title: Running Can’t Save You. But It Can Help.
item.description: There are deep connections between how I train and the way I live and work.

item.title: I Thought Graham Platner Was Finished. What I Saw in Maine Changed My Mind.
item.description: A Senate candidate’s popularity reveals the depth of Democratic disaffection.

item.title: Why Even Basic A.I. Use Is So Bad for Students
item.description: Artificial intelligence threatens students’ most basic skills. If they lose their ability to understand what they read, will they lose their ability to think?

item.title: The Empty Promises of Trump’s Imperial Presidency
item.description: It may take an imperial Congress to correct its flaws.

item.title: What Happened to the Art of the Deal?
item.description: We urge the administration to allow millions of Americans to receive food aid.

item.title: It’s Not the Autopen. It’s What We Don’t Know About Biden’s Last Days in Office.
item.description: What happens when a President’s physical or mental decline makes him unfit to continue to serve?

item.title: The Real Horrors of America
item.description: On watching the 1959 film “House on Haunted Hill” and America’s real monsters.

item.title: Democrats’ Battle for Attention, and Trust
item.description: Readers respond to an Opinion guest essay by Chris Hayes. Also: Reining in President Trump; a risk to the Trump library; healing America.

item.title: Why Trump’s Talk About Nuclear Testing Is Dangerous
item.description: The president’s ambiguity on nuclear testing is worrisome not only because America’s public can’t know what he means, but because America’s adversaries don’t.

item.title: Who Is Watching the Watchers?
item.description: The U.S. government doesn’t — and technically can’t — watch citizens every minute of every day. Palantir’s C.T.O. thinks the world would be safer if that ability were controlled, but still existed.

item.title: Amit Segal on the Future of Governance in Gaza
item.description: Amit Segal, a prominent Israeli right-wing commentator, discusses how he thinks about the future of governance in Gaza.

item.title: We Need to Rethink How We Think About the Holocaust
item.description: Professor Marianne Hirsch on how the way we teach the “crime of all crimes” informs our understanding of Gaza.

item.title: Resistance to Trump Isn’t Enough
item.description: Why liberals need a plan and promise to make Congress great again.

item.title: There Are So Many Ways to Shut Down a Country
item.description: The moderate vs. progressive debate will not be solved on Tuesday.

item.title: Palantir’s C.T.O. on ICE: ‘People Voted on This’
item.description: Disagreement over how the Trump administration has approached deportations “is the beauty of the political process,” Palantir’s C.T.O., Shyam Sankar, argues on “Interesting Times.”

item.title: The Reality of Living With Wolves, Bears and Mountain Lions
item.description: Recent conflicts between wolves and people expose major shortcomings of America’s efforts to bring back predators.

item.title: The World Has Again Failed to Prevent Atrocities in Darfur
item.description: Reports are emerging of atrocities in Darfur. The Trump and Biden administrations could have tried harder to prevent them.

item.title: The Doctor Who Hates Medicine
item.description: The anti-expert expert is up for the nation’s top doctor job.

item.title: I Now Mispronounce You the Likely Next Mayor of New York City
item.description: A lot of people seem to trip over Zohran Mamdani’s name. The reason may not be as simple as it seems.

item.title: All It Took for Trump to Dismantle the Justice Dept.
item.description: The cumulative damage done to the agency is so profound that it may not regain any semblance of its former self in our lifetimes.

item.title: Scientists Need to Take Headaches Seriously
item.description: One in seven Americans has migraines. They deserve relief.

item.title: The Canadians Are Right About Reagan and Free Trade
item.description: Reagan would not have approved of Trump’s tariffs.

item.title: What Palantir Sees
item.description: The tech company’s C.T.O. on surveillance, A.I. and the future of war.

item.title: Josh Hawley’s Plea for Food Assistance
item.description: Readers respond to the senator’s Opinion guest essay about the possible cutoff of SNAP benefits.

item.title: The Fed Resisted Trump. Can It Resist a Return of Inflation?
item.description: The Federal Reserve didn’t comply with President Trump’s wishes.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa Maxed Out What Scientists Thought Was Possible
item.description: Western Jamaica experienced something near to the worst tropical cyclone impacts our planet can produce.

item.title: Trump Lost the Trade War to China
item.description: Xi now sees our weakness and will try to exploit it, perhaps leaving America a diminished presence in Asia.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s Trad Turn
item.description: Is Taylor Swift’s “The Life of a Showgirl” the soundtrack for the Trump era? The Times Opinion columnist and self-proclaimed “conservative dad” Ross Douthat thinks so, and explains why.

item.title: A Nazi Tattoo Exposes Democrats’ Greatest Weakness
item.description: Do Democrats know what the working class actually looks like?

item.title: $149.57 Is Going to Have to Feed My Family Indefinitely
item.description: I rely on SNAP benefits. That requires constant trade-offs.

item.title: People Still Want to Marry. Why Aren’t They?
item.description: The era of relationship discontent.

item.title: Josh Hawley: We Cannot Let 42 Million Americans Go Hungry
item.description: Congress must prevent Americans from losing food assistance.

item.title: Big Wellness Finds an Easy Target With Perimenopause
item.description: Will ashwagandha cure my “cortisol face”?

item.title: How Trumpism Has Affected Israeli Politics
item.description: Amit Segal, a prominent Israeli right-wing commentator, traces the evolution of Israeli politics since Trump’s political rise.

item.title: Would Term Limits for Congress Help or Hurt?
item.description: Readers respond to an Opinion guest essay by Gov. Ron DeSantis and former Representative David Trone.

item.title: The Israeli Right’s Plan to Carve Up Gaza
item.description: Amit Segal, a prominent Israeli right-wing commentator, envisions the future of the Gaza Strip.
